name: Mons Badonicus
description:
The year is 493 AD.

On his return from a campaign in the north, the British warlord Arthur finds his domain under attack from invading Saxons. The Saxon Bretwalda Ælle of Sussex has besieged the British fortress at "Mons Badonicus", or "Badon Hill", in an attempt to seize Arthur's lands.

Arthur must lift the siege, and cast the heathen horde back into the seas from whence they came.

Features

  • Large scale 3D battles
  • Realtime tactical combat
  • Command and fight against a variety of units
  • Morale system
  • A grounded interpretation of Arthurian myth
  • Controllable game speed

This game was made in a week for the Historically Accurate jam, due to the rules of the jam there will be no updates for the duration of the voting period. So if something breaks or is just terrible, I apologize :( . I will be making a tutorial shortly.

This game was made relying heavily on this Grid Formation tutorial and source code by Jonas Mun: https://jonas-mun.gitlab.io/blog/tutorials/grid_formation/grid_formation/

Icons from: https://game-icons.net/

Base human mesh models from UMA: https://github.com/umasteeringgroup/content-pack/tree/master/ContentPack_2.7.0.0...

Sounds from ZapSplat: https://www.zapsplat.com/sound-effect-categories/

More credits included in Credits.doc
